value.title: Apple launches AI/ML residency program to attract niche experts
value.excerpt: The company behind Siri is looking for U.S. and European residents with programming and niche science backgrounds to immerse in the world of AI and ML.

value.title: Google Offers to Help Others With the Tricky Ethics of AI
value.excerpt: After learning its own ethics lessons the hard way, the tech giant will offer services like spotting racial bias or developing guidelines around AI projects.

value.title: Are Robots Eating Our Jobs? Not According To AI
value.excerpt: AI is replacing jobs while creating new ones and new job roles â€” profound benefits to the global economy await their arrival.

value.title: IBM will use AI to pipe in simulated crowd noise during the U.S. Open
value.excerpt: IBM plans to apply AI and machine learning solutions to new challenges brought on by the pandemic during the 140th U.S. Open.

value.title: US Open won't have spectators, but it will have IBM's AI and hybrid cloud
value.excerpt: Fans will be able to use IBM's new tech features as they watch the Grand Slam event from home this year.  This year, IBM has developed three new tennis-based digital experiences for fans of the US Open.

value.title: IBM hopes to power US Open's digital experiences with Watson's natural language processing
value.excerpt: The US Open can't have fans this year so IBM is hoping it can use AI to fuel debates, experiences and even the noise in the stadium.

value.title: AI Jesus will help you embrace the apocalypse
value.excerpt: The neural network spat out some baffling verses after studying the King James Bible In yet another sign that the end of the world is nigh, an AI Jesus has arisen with a new set of apocalyptic biblical verses.

value.title: Apple Announces New AI and Machine Learning Residency Program

value.title: All Is Fair In Mortgage Lending And Fintech?
value.excerpt: This second in a three-part series examines the limitations of artificial intelligence, and highlights the ramifications on the rapidly heating US lending and refinancing market.

value.title: White House, Under Fire for Discouraging Coronavirus Testing, Says It Will Buy Millions of Test Kits
value.excerpt: President Trump promised a vaccine by the end of the year. For hurricane-battered Louisiana and Texas, a confluence of disaster.

value.title: AI company Staqu collaborates with Microsoft to bring â€˜JARVISâ€™ on Azure
value.excerpt: AI implementation company, Staqu has collaborated with Microsoft to bring its video analytics solutions on Microsoft Azure. The collaboration enables Staquâ€™s proprietary video analytics solutions including JARVIS (Joint AI Research for Video Instances and Streams) to be integrated with Azure Kubernetes Service and Azure Stack Edge.

value.title: Ancient Chinese terracotta warrior brought to life by coder using artificial intelligence algorithms
value.excerpt: An indie game developer uses computer tools to create a video of realistic-looking historic figures in motion based on portraits and sculptures.

value.title: Latest NVIDIA SHIELD Update Brings AI Upscaling Enhancements And New Features
value.excerpt: Over and above the excellent hardware, NVIDIA has been religious about consistently releasing updates for the SHIELD TV that only make what was already a great device even better.

value.title: How facial recognition technology could be utilized in a COVID-19 world
value.excerpt: It's not science fiction or the movies; facial recognition technology is now part of our world. TensorMark Inc., a US cloud-based AI and computer vision technology provider, is working with University Hospitals to come up with a way to make it work during the COVID-19 pandemic.

value.title: Learn from the first place winner of the first AWS DeepComposer Chartbusters Bach to the Future Challenge
value.excerpt: AWS is excited to announce the winner of the first AWS DeepComposer Chartbusters Challenge, Catherine Chui. value.title: This tiny AI chip obliterates Google rival in a crucial metric

value.title: Algorithmia unveils MLops for teams
value.excerpt: Algorithmia Teams delivers machine learning operations and management for small groups as a pay-as-you-go cloud service

value.title: How machine learning is identifying and tracking pandemics like COVID-19
value.excerpt: BlueDot's machine learning platformÂ anticipates the spread and impact of over 150 different pathogens, toxins, and syndromes in near-real time.

value.title: How a Scots Wikipedia scandal highlighted AIâ€™s data problem
value.excerpt: A Reddit user discovered that most articles aren't written in Scots, raising questions for AI models trained on Wikipedia data.

value.title: AI buoyed businesses during the pandemic, and could accelerate permanent change
value.excerpt: IPSoft found that most businesses plan to return furloughed workers to their jobs, but many think AI will change or eliminate those positions within the next two years, white-collar included.

value.title: Kneron launches its new AI chip to challenge Google and others
value.excerpt: Fresh off a $40 million Series A round, edge AI specialist Kneron today announced the launch of its newest custom chip, the Kneron KL 720 SoC. With funding from the likes of Alibaba, Sequoia, Horizons Ventures,

value.title: Move.ai enables AI motion capture without the hassle for video game production
value.excerpt: Move.ai can use artificial intelligence to capture a 3D representation of an actor in a process known as markerless motion capture.

value.title: Amazon Launches an AI-Powered Health and Wellness Band Called Halo
value.excerpt: Amazon has today signaled its intention to grab a share of the fitness tracker market by introducing Amazon Halo â€”a health and wellness band combined with a "suite of AI-powered health features" accessed via the Halo app on Android or iOS.

value.title: Porn Site Stripchat Inadvertently Discovers Next Best Use Case For AI
value.excerpt: Stripchat, a live camming platform that boasts over 60 million visits per month, has launched a new AI service tool that might just provide us with a glimpse into the next service area of deep machine learning and AI.

value.title: PopIDâ€™s face-based payments pose privacy and security risks
value.excerpt: PopID, a face-based payments tech vendor intent on expanding across the U.S., has problematic privacy and security policies.
